name: Mount Liberty

trails_config.name: Liberty Spring Trail
trails_config.description: A direct, steep climb passing the Liberty Spring Tentsite. The summit is a sharp, rocky spire offering dramatic views of the 'Slide' on Mt. Flume.
trails_config.parking_info: Flume Gorge Visitor Center, US-3, Lincoln, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on Mount Liberty. At 4459 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4459 feet, Mount Liberty is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Liberty Spring Trail**, a **8.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
